column5: Went into Jiggy this weekend for the first time to open up the camp and cut down some really big pines that were hanging the wrong way and were a danger if they came down.  Good weekend for animal viewing 2 swamp donkeys, 9 bush chickens, 3 beavers, 1 otter, and a cute porky pick.  North enough for there to still be snow on the ground from the last squall.  Did a bit of fishing to no avail.. the rivers pretty low... July levels really. Fishing never good early anyway.. lol.. ya thats it.  I was pretty impressed we managed to take these monsters down, right next to and in between the two camps and put them right where I wanted them. Lots of cord wood for sure now.  <object width="660" height="405"><param name="movie" value="                      Didnt even need the cooler!!
Sweet. Still can't get over the early spring we've had.  I'm just itchin' to get up to my place too.
Now you're pissin me off Quesnel !!!
I am not sure what it is, but I love Jiggy Jiggy photos. Thanks! Jim
The wife's got a little wood to split, eh T.J.?
" I'm a lumberjack and I'm ok..." hahahahahaha Good report Bud.
a sure sign of spring..the camp is open
HAHAHA.. I've seen him dress in Wimmin's clothing tooo Roy !!!
Am I the only one that has no idea what that thing is?
Thing? What thing Dan?
The animal climbing the tree or the lumberjack song?
Toookie.. TJ... or the Porqupine??
Is that a Porqupine?
Yep.. a bigg'un
I see to recall a pic the last time ya let yer beer lyin' around.
All those "SPAMMING ADBOTS" are paying of I see.
LOL.. Im still drinkin' Carling.
I'm cool with that. Beer me.
At first glance I thought that thing in the tree was just ape TJ with a shirtless back facing the camera.  Camp wintered well........ wait a minute........ did we even have a winter????
Ah.... The season begins!  Nice to see TJ.  Cheers, Ron...
That's one big porcupine, glad he didn't give you something to remember him by  Looks like you guys did alot of work.  Looking more like a homestead than camp now TJ.  Joey
T.J. You're talking to the porcupine.  Glad the camp is open. Maybe I'll get there sometime on the bikes with Denis A.  Nipfisher (a.k.a. Blair)
LOL.. Ya your right... its been a long winter.
All I can say is, No I can't say that here. Even with all that clearing work. I'm still so jealous.
cant wait for a fish report camp is looking awesome
